item.title: The Theory of Post-Imperialism and the Immigration Dilemma
item.description: The Theory of Post-Imperialism and the Immigration Dilemma Historically, monarchs and imperial powers plundered wealth and resources from colonies in Africa, Asia, and South America. By “monarchs,” we refer not only to emperors but also to those individuals who amassed substantial fortunes through the exploitation of these colonies. The nexus between wealth and politics is profound. Those with financial resources have the capability to influence governments, academic institutions, and various organizations by deploying lobbyists.
